byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH, CHRISTOPHER DREW and SEAN D. NAYLOR

abstract: Eric Greitens, who is leveraging his past experience as Navy SEAL in his bid for governorship of Missouri, is facing accusations from past comrades that he has exaggerated his record and is exploiting SEALs name; organization, which once prized discretion, is trying to rein in public appearances by Greitens and other former SEALs, while many internally remain split on issue.
lead_paragraph: The SEALs face a widening split over what many in the ranks describe as personal exploitation of a brotherhood that once prized discretion.

headline.main: Rift Among Navy SEALs Over Members Who Cash In on Brand
headline.print_headline: Among Navy SEALs, a Split Over Cashing In on the Brand

snippet: The SEALs face a widening split over what many in the ranks describe as personal exploitation of a brotherhood that once prized discretion.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
